Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Vivian Mae Leighton Papers TAM 406
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
1953-1955 Vivian Mae Leighton (b. March 5, 1910) was a U.S. citizen employed by the United Nations, beginning in 1946, and was also apparently an alumnus of Brown University. In 1955, she submitted her replies to a questionnaire from the International Organizations Loyalty Board, established by Executive Order 10422 [c.a. 1953], pertaining to the employment of U.S. citizens by international organizations, notably the United Nations. This small collection includes the questionnair filled out by Leighton and related correspondence, a copy of Executive Order 10422, The Secretary General's Remarks to the United Nations Correspondents Association (July 10, 1953), which include discussion of the Order, and an envelope from the Brown University Almnae Fund. 1
